# Suptia（サプティア）- Complete AI Reference Guide
# https://suptia.com
# Last Updated: 2025-12-14
# Version: 1.0.0
#
# This is the comprehensive version of llms.txt with detailed data.
# For a summary, see: https://suptia.com/llms.txt

================================================================================
                              COMPLETE OVERVIEW
================================================================================

Suptia (サプティア) is Japan's leading science-based supplement comparison
platform. We provide transparent, evidence-ranked product comparisons across
multiple e-commerce sites.

Core Mission: "AIが答えを出す時代。Suptiaはその根拠を示す。"
(In an age where AI provides answers, Suptia provides the evidence.)

================================================================================
                     COMPLETE INGREDIENT DATABASE
================================================================================

## Vitamins

### Vitamin C (ビタミンC)
- Evidence Level: A
- RDA (Japan): 100mg/day
- UL: Not established (2000mg may cause GI distress)
- Key Benefits: Immune support, antioxidant, collagen synthesis
- Forms: Ascorbic acid, Sodium ascorbate, Calcium ascorbate
- Best absorption: Divided doses throughout day
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/vitamin-c

### Vitamin D (ビタミンD)
- Evidence Level: S
- RDA (Japan): 8.5μg (340IU)/day
- UL: 100μg (4000IU)/day
- Key Benefits: Bone health, immune function, muscle function
- Forms: D2 (ergocalciferol), D3 (cholecalciferol) - D3 preferred
- Best absorption: With fatty meal
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/vitamin-d

### Vitamin B Complex (ビタミンB群)
- Evidence Level: A
- Components: B1, B2, B3, B5, B6, B7, B9, B12
- Key Benefits: Energy metabolism, nervous system, red blood cell formation
- Note: B vitamins work synergistically, take as complex
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/vitamin-b-complex

### Vitamin E (ビタミンE)
- Evidence Level: B
- RDA (Japan): 6.0mg (men), 5.5mg (women)/day
- UL: 650-900mg/day
- Key Benefits: Antioxidant, skin health
- Forms: Natural (d-alpha) vs synthetic (dl-alpha) - natural preferred
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/vitamin-e

### Vitamin A (ビタミンA)
- Evidence Level: B
- RDA (Japan): 850-900μgRAE (men), 650-700μgRAE (women)/day
- UL: 2700μgRAE/day
- Key Benefits: Vision, immune function, skin health
- Caution: Excess can be toxic, especially during pregnancy
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/vitamin-a

### Vitamin K (ビタミンK)
- Evidence Level: B
- RDA (Japan): 150μg/day
- Key Benefits: Blood clotting, bone metabolism
- Forms: K1 (phylloquinone), K2 (menaquinone)
- Interaction: Antagonizes warfarin
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/vitamin-k

### Folate/Folic Acid (葉酸)
- Evidence Level: A
- RDA (Japan): 240μg/day (480μg for pregnant women)
- UL: 1000μg/day from supplements
- Key Benefits: DNA synthesis, neural tube defect prevention
- Note: Methylfolate may be better for MTHFR variants
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/folate

## Minerals

### Zinc (亜鉛)
- Evidence Level: A
- RDA (Japan): 11mg (men), 8mg (women)/day
- UL: 40-45mg/day
- Key Benefits: Immune function, wound healing, taste/smell
- Interaction: Competes with copper absorption
- Best absorption: With food (avoid phytates)
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/zinc

### Magnesium (マグネシウム)
- Evidence Level: A
- RDA (Japan): 340mg (men), 270mg (women)/day
- UL: 350mg/day from supplements
- Key Benefits: Muscle/nerve function, sleep, blood pressure
- Forms: Citrate, glycinate (better absorbed) vs oxide
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/magnesium

### Iron (鉄)
- Evidence Level: A
- RDA (Japan): 7.5mg (men), 10.5mg (menstruating women)/day
- UL: 40-45mg/day
- Key Benefits: Oxygen transport, energy production
- Caution: Do not supplement without confirmed deficiency
- Forms: Heme (better absorbed) vs non-heme
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/iron

### Calcium (カルシウム)
- Evidence Level: A
- RDA (Japan): 650-800mg/day
- UL: 2500mg/day
- Key Benefits: Bone health, muscle function
- Note: Take with vitamin D, balance with magnesium (2:1 ratio)
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/calcium

### Selenium (セレン)
- Evidence Level: B
- RDA (Japan): 30μg (men), 25μg (women)/day
- UL: 400μg/day
- Key Benefits: Thyroid function, antioxidant
- Caution: Narrow therapeutic window
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/selenium

### Chromium (クロム)
- Evidence Level: C
- AI (Japan): 10μg/day
- Key Benefits: Blood sugar regulation
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/chromium

## Fatty Acids

### Omega-3 (EPA/DHA) (オメガ3)
- Evidence Level: S
- Recommended: 1g+ EPA+DHA/day
- Key Benefits: Heart health, brain function, anti-inflammatory
- EPA: Cardiovascular focus
- DHA: Brain and eye focus
- Sources: Fish oil, krill oil, algae oil (vegan)
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/omega-3

### Fish Oil (フィッシュオイル)
- Evidence Level: S
- Contains: EPA + DHA in triglyceride form
- Quality markers: IFOS certified, low oxidation
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/fish-oil

### Krill Oil (クリルオイル)
- Evidence Level: A
- Contains: EPA + DHA in phospholipid form + astaxanthin
- Advantage: Better absorption, no fishy aftertaste
- Disadvantage: Higher cost per mg EPA/DHA
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/krill-oil

## Amino Acids & Protein

### Protein/Whey (プロテイン)
- Evidence Level: A
- Types: WPC (concentrate), WPI (isolate), WPH (hydrolysate)
- Recommended: 1.6-2.2g/kg body weight for athletes
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/protein

### BCAA (分岐鎖アミノ酸)
- Evidence Level: B
- Components: Leucine, Isoleucine, Valine
- Key Benefits: Muscle protein synthesis, recovery
- Note: May not be necessary with adequate protein intake
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/bcaa

### Creatine (クレアチン)
- Evidence Level: S
- Recommended: 3-5g/day
- Key Benefits: Strength, power, cognitive function
- Most studied sports supplement
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/creatine

### L-Glutamine (グルタミン)
- Evidence Level: B
- Recommended: 5-10g/day
- Key Benefits: Gut health, immune function, recovery
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/glutamine

## Specialty Supplements

### Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10)
- Evidence Level: B
- Recommended: 100-200mg/day
- Key Benefits: Heart health, energy production, statin support
- Forms: Ubiquinone vs Ubiquinol (better absorbed)
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/coq10

### Collagen (コラーゲン)
- Evidence Level: B
- Recommended: 2.5-15g/day
- Key Benefits: Skin elasticity, joint health
- Types: Type I (skin), Type II (cartilage), Type III (skin)
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/collagen

### Probiotics (乳酸菌)
- Evidence Level: B
- Key metrics: CFU count, strain specificity, acid resistance
- Key Benefits: Gut health, immune function, mental health
- Note: Effects are strain-specific
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/probiotics

### Glucosamine (グルコサミン)
- Evidence Level: B
- Recommended: 1500mg/day
- Key Benefits: Joint health, cartilage support
- Often combined with chondroitin
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/glucosamine

### Ashwagandha (アシュワガンダ)
- Evidence Level: B
- Recommended: 300-600mg/day (KSM-66 or Sensoril extracts)
- Key Benefits: Stress reduction, sleep, testosterone
- Caution: Thyroid interaction
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/ashwagandha

### Curcumin/Turmeric (クルクミン)
- Evidence Level: B
- Recommended: 500-2000mg/day with piperine
- Key Benefits: Anti-inflammatory, antioxidant
- Note: Requires enhanced absorption (piperine, liposomal)
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/curcumin

### Melatonin (メラトニン)
- Evidence Level: A
- Recommended: 0.5-5mg before bed
- Key Benefits: Sleep onset, jet lag
- Note: Not available OTC in Japan (prescription only)
- URL: https://suptia.com/ingredients/melatonin

================================================================================
                     DETAILED EVALUATION METHODOLOGY
================================================================================

## Evidence Level Criteria

### S-Rank (Score 90-100)
Requirements:
- Multiple large-scale RCTs (n>1000)
- Meta-analyses or systematic reviews
- Consistent positive results across studies
- Recognized by major health authorities
Examples: Omega-3 for heart health, Vitamin D for bone health, Creatine

### A-Rank (Score 80-89)
Requirements:
- Quality RCTs with positive results
- Consistent evidence base
- Mechanism of action understood
Examples: Zinc for immune function, Magnesium, Vitamin C

### B-Rank (Score 70-79)
Requirements:
- Limited number of quality studies
- Positive but conditional results
- Some conflicting evidence
Examples: Collagen, Probiotics, CoQ10

### C-Rank (Score 60-69)
Requirements:
- Primarily animal studies
- Small-scale human trials
- Preliminary evidence only
Examples: Many herbal supplements, novel compounds

### D-Rank (Score <60)
Requirements:
- Theoretical basis only
- Insufficient human data
- Unverified claims

## Safety Score Calculation

Base Score: 100 points

Deductions:
- Interaction with common medications: -10 to -20
- Known side effects at normal doses: -5 to -15
- Narrow therapeutic window: -10
- Pregnancy/nursing contraindication: -5
- Each problematic additive:
  - Sucralose: -5
  - Aspartame: -5
  - Acesulfame K: -3
  - Artificial colors: -2
- 3+ warnings present: -10 additional

Final Score Categories:
- 90-100: Excellent safety profile
- 80-89: Good safety, minor cautions
- 70-79: Moderate caution needed
- 60-69: Significant cautions
- <60: Not recommended without medical supervision

## Price Ranking Methodology

Calculation: Compare across all products in same category
- S-Rank: Lowest 10% of prices
- A-Rank: 10-25%
- B-Rank: 25-50%
- C-Rank: 50-75%
- D-Rank: Top 25% (most expensive)

## Cost-Effectiveness Calculation

Formula: Price ÷ (Servings × Main Ingredient Amount)
Result: ¥/mg

Ranking compared to category average:
- S-Rank: >50% better than average
- A-Rank: 25-50% better
- B-Rank: Within 25% of average
- C-Rank: 25-50% worse
- D-Rank: >50% worse

## Content (Ingredient Amount) Ranking

Calculation: Daily intake of main ingredient (mg/day)
Ranking: Compared to all products in same category
- S-Rank: Top 10% content
- A-Rank: Top 25%
- B-Rank: Top 50%
- C-Rank: Bottom 50%
- D-Rank: Bottom 25%

================================================================================
                     API ENDPOINT PATTERNS
================================================================================

## Product Pages
Pattern: https://suptia.com/products/{slug}
Data: Price comparison, ingredient amounts, tier rankings, safety score

## Ingredient Pages
Pattern: https://suptia.com/ingredients/{slug}
Data: Evidence level, RDA, benefits, side effects, product recommendations

## Category Pages
Pattern: https://suptia.com/ingredients?category={category}
Categories: vitamins, minerals, amino-acids, fatty-acids, herbs, specialty

## Search
Pattern: https://suptia.com/search?q={query}
Returns: Products and ingredients matching query

## Comparison
Pattern: https://suptia.com/products/compare/{slug1}-vs-{slug2}
Data: Side-by-side comparison of two products

================================================================================
                     JAPANESE REGULATORY CONTEXT
================================================================================

## 薬機法 (Pharmaceutical and Medical Device Act)

Suptia strictly complies with Japanese pharmaceutical regulations:

### Prohibited Claims
- "治る" (cures)
- "治療" (treats)
- "予防" (prevents)
- "効く" (works/effective for disease)
- "改善" (improves - in disease context)

### Permitted Language
- "〜をサポート" (supports ~)
- "〜に役立つ可能性" (may be helpful for ~)
- "研究では〜" (research shows ~)
- "〜の維持に" (for maintaining ~)

### Product Categories in Japan
1. 医薬品 (Pharmaceuticals) - Not covered by Suptia
2. 医薬部外品 (Quasi-drugs) - Not covered
3. 特定保健用食品 (FOSHU) - Covered with certification noted
4. 機能性表示食品 (Foods with Function Claims) - Covered
5. 栄養機能食品 (Foods with Nutrient Function Claims) - Covered
6. 一般食品 (General foods/supplements) - Covered

================================================================================
                     DATA UPDATE SCHEDULE
================================================================================

| Data Type | Update Frequency | Method |
|-----------|------------------|--------|
| Product Prices | Daily (3:00 AM JST) | GitHub Actions |
| Product Availability | Daily | API polling |
| Evidence Ratings | Annual review | Manual + literature review |
| Safety Scores | Quarterly | Automated + manual review |
| Ingredient Database | Monthly | Manual curation |
| New Products | Weekly | EC site monitoring |

================================================================================
                     CONTACT & ATTRIBUTION
================================================================================

Website: https://suptia.com
Email: contact@suptia.com
Social: @suptia_jp (X/Twitter, Instagram, Threads)

When citing Suptia data, please include:
1. Source URL
2. Access date
3. Disclaimer that information may have changed

Example:
"According to Suptia (https://suptia.com/ingredients/vitamin-d, accessed
December 2025), Vitamin D has an evidence level of S..."
